summary: Email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorney Maurene Comey, attorney Gloria Allred, and Diane Aldrich regarding travel arrangements for victims to attend a court conference on August 27, 2019, following Jeffrey Epstein's death. The conference, scheduled by Judge Berman, would address the dismissal of the indictment and allow victims to be heard.

events.title: Court Conference on Dismissal
events.description: Judge Berman scheduled a conference regarding the dismissal of the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein in light of his death. Victims are allowed to be heard during the proceeding.

events.title: Travel Coordination for Victims
events.description: Email correspondence arranging government-funded travel for victims to attend the August 27 court conference in New York.

locations: 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A court conference was scheduled for August 27, 2019, to address the dismissal of the indictment against Jeffrey Epstein following his death.
Judge Berman indicated that victims would be allowed to be heard—either directly or through counsel—during the proceeding.
The U.S. Attorney's Office offered to provide government-funded travel assistance for victims who could not afford to attend the conference.
Attorney Gloria Allred confirmed three victims (with a potential fourth) wished to attend and required travel assistance, including possible two-night stays.
Coordination for victim travel was delegated to Diane Aldrich, who had expertise in government travel funding parameters.
